Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a light-brown granular deposit, the exterior is covered with an off-white slip and three lines of hieratic text, one in red and two in black.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate XCV n. 277
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393958) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393958)
